programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Behind the Hunt
programme.desc: The cameras are turned around, as we get a tour of life "behind the scenes" on Dog the Bounty Hunter. Using interviews with Dog and the posse, the TV crew, and never before seen footage, this is one of most revealing and heartfelt episodes of the series.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: God Looks on the Heart
programme.desc: This fugitive spells trouble for Dog in today's hunt. When the leads grow cold it's the US Postal Service to the rescue as a mail carrier lends a helping hand. Dog's team surrounds the suspected safe house and silently awaits their prey.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Big Brother
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in. Dog's plan is to convince family that everyone is best served if the fugitive mans up and takes care of business.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mid-Course Correction
programme.desc: Dog's target for today was once an upstanding member of his community. Now with no home, no job and the law on his trail, this middle-aged exile from middle-class society is using the cold end of an ice pipe to soothe his troubled soul.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Baby's Back in Town
programme.desc: Dog tries to nab a fugitive, named Wayne, by calling and telling him that he's won a new vacuum cleaner and he should stick around to get it. Dog then sends his daughter, Lyssa, to "deliver" the vacuum cleaner and lure Wayne out of his house.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Surprise! Surprise!
programme.desc: Dog and his team are out to revoke bail on Eugene, a chronic heroin addict. They find him in a squalid apartment with a huge stockpile of syringes, and they can see that his physical condition is deteriorating.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: No Ice in Paradise
programme.desc: Dog and his team fight the war on ice-crystal methamphetamine-on many fronts. They appear on a special anti-drug float in a parade. Then they go after bail-jumping Pana, a convicted drug dealer.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Fathers in Law
programme.desc: Hunting down a fugitive known as "Bozo," Dog gets help from an unexpected source, Bozo's father-in-law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bosco the Clown
programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Tickets To The Fun Show
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room. The massage chair becomes a detriment to the workflow, so Willie takes Si around for a replacement prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Be a Lady
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ring Around the Redneck
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Bass Man Standing
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Battle of the Brothers
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dyeing his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Aloha, Robertsons!
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii. But Willie's daily itinerary for the trip gets constantly undermined by the family's desire to participate in their own island activities.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Till Duck Do Us Part
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane".

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: So You Think You Can Date?
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance. When babysitting for Jep and Jessica turns into a rocky road.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hot Tub Grime Machine
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out. Godwin asks them to help him get a hot tub, so they set out to help him pick one up.

programme.title: Behind Bars: The World's Toughest Prisons
programme.desc: The inmates in the Carcel Distrital in Colombia fight many battles: against other prisoners, against the guards and most of all against themselves. It's a battle that most of them lose.

programme.title: Behind Bars: The World's Toughest Prisons
programme.desc: The Carcel Distrital is located in one of the most dangerous quarters of Bogotá. Nearly 950 men and 50 women are imprisoned here.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler Search and Rescue helicopter long-lines an injured snowmobiler off a steep mountainside.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: In Crawford Bay near Nelson British Columbia, search teams are looking for a missing 1946 two-seater vintage Ercoupe.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Whistler Search and Rescue combs the backcountry for a missing snowshoer.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson SAR takes a maiden voyage in their new rescue boat to save a single mother and her young son.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Lions Bay and North Shore Rescue team up to long-line a severely injured French mountain climber off a steep rock face.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson Search and Rescue is en route to the scene of a helicopter crash in the Kootenay River.

programme.title: Callout Search And Rescue
programme.desc: Nelson Search and Rescue rookies get a chance to show their stuff while helping an injured hiker.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Brexit
programme.desc: Over 17 years of marriage Leon has had countless affairs with other women and Siobhan has had it. She claims all he wants is for her to keep his house clean and pick up after him. Leon argues that the problems stem from Siobhan’s bad drinking habits.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 1
programme.desc: Jacoby Garrett is fighting to save his marriage of 15 years. Meanwhile his wife, Kim Garrett has her belongings packed and is waiting on the moving truck.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 2
programme.desc: Jacoby says his wife has stolen money to feed her gambling addiction. Kim says that his mother is a huge thorn in her side. In 15 years, Kim says she is still scratching her head as to why Jacoby’s mother bad mouths her to everyone.

programme.title: Divorce Court: All Eyes on Me
programme.desc: Selina is sleepless in Sarasota, lying awake in the night, calling her boyfriend Derrick to make sure he’s alone. He admits he sees other women, but doesn’t consider it cheating because he’s not having sex. How much longer can Selina play detective?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Hashtag Freaky
programme.desc: Anita says Ronald is a chronic cheater and a sex addict. He demands sex constantly and when doesn’t get his way, he admits he feels forced to seek sex outside the marriage. Can Judge Toler save this couple?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Done Done
programme.desc: Nichele says Stewart would pay the neighbors to spy on her. She says he was never supportive when it came to parenting. Stewart says Nichele has always denied cheating on him but he believes in his heart she did.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Fantasy Fail
programme.desc: Victoria is sick of Casey neglecting his responsibilities. Casey feels like a slave for taking care of the kids while she flies around the world for modeling gigs. Can Casey break out of the Mr. Mom role and start helping with the bills?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 1
programme.desc: Jacoby Garrett is fighting to save his marriage of 15 years. Meanwhile his wife, Kim Garrett has her belongings packed and is waiting on the moving truck.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Uninvited Guest Part 2
programme.desc: Jacoby says his wife has stolen money to feed her gambling addiction. Kim says that his mother is a huge thorn in her side. In 15 years, Kim says she is still scratching her head as to why Jacoby’s mother bad mouths her to everyone.

programme.desc: Billy wants Marylu to quit pole dancing and stripping, while she wants Billy to confess if he’s straight or not. Billy has a fetish for wearing women’s underwear and he needs to fess up if he likes women, men or both.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Repo, the Final Frontier
programme.desc: First, Froy and Sonia trace an out-of-state skip account to a seedy motel, where they come face-to-face with a hopping-mad cowboy and his female companion. Then, Matt and Sonia go where no repo man has gone before to repossess a Ford.

programme.title: Operation Repo: All In

programme.title: Operation Repo: Up Up and Away
programme.desc: First, it's up, up, and away, for Lou, Froy, and Matt. All of their skills are tested when they attempt to take down not one, but two hot air balloons. Then, Lou and Froy find themselves in the wrong part of town, repo'ing a sports car.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Cement Mixer
programme.desc: When a debtor and his friends resort to baseball bats, chaos erupts, and Lou, Lyndah, and Sonia fight not only with them but also with each other. Down in Texas, Matt and Froy wait to clear up Froy's warrant and get in way over their heads working...

programme.title: Operation Repo: Four Wheel Surprise
programme.desc: Matt and Froy walk into a moral gray area when they repossess a vehicle by stealing it. Then, Sonia and Matt discover their target van is being used in an investigation of highly toxic material. And, Matt poses as a valet to retrieve a car from an irate..

programme.title: Operation Repo: Rolling Away
programme.desc: First, Lou, Sonia, and Froy have to push away a debtor while trying to push a classic car up a hill and onto the flatbed. And later, Matt and Froy head out on a repo for a BMW, but when the camera guy refuses to leave the car and Matt's lunch starts to...

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Michael B. Jordan
programme.desc: Actor Michael B. Jordan joins Grylls in Wales where they start their journey by dropping into rough waters off the coast before making their way up the coast and to the top of the mountains for their exit.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Scott Eastwood
programme.desc: Actor Scott Eastwood joins Bear on a journey through the harsh Bulgarian outback; the duo rappel from a towering arch, cross a raging river, descend into a dark cave and face off against a snake; Scott details growing up with his famous father.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Michelle Rodriguez
programme.desc: Actress Michelle Rodriguez and Bear go to a desert Nevada; unexpected high winds during a sky-diving trip send Michelle off course; Michelle and Bear must come up with clever ways to stay hydrated.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Shaquille O'Neal
programme.desc: Bear and NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal are lifted from a freight train via helicopter and whisked away to a dense forest in the remote Adirondacks; they face blood-sucking leeches, and a 200-foot rock face as they search for their exit.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Uzo Aduba
programme.desc: Uzo Aduba joins Bear on a harrowing journey to Spain's Pyrenees Mountains, where they face a poisonous viper and secure a dinner of field mice; Uzo shares the story of her path to fame and her family's emigration from Nigeria.

programme.title: Running Wild With Bear Grylls: Bear Grylls, Roger Federer
programme.desc: Bear takes one of the best athletes of all time, Roger Federer, on a daring adventure through the Swiss Alps as they attempt to navigate the tough terrain. They descend a frozen waterfall and use tennis rackets as snowshoes.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Glaciers
programme.desc: Clinging to the world’s highest mountains and forming ice caps on both poles, glaciers leave an impression on the landscape and on all who bear witness to their splendor.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Cruises
programme.desc: There is something seductive about setting sail. Cruises offer us a chance to dip our toes into the 70% of our planet awash with oceans, rivers, and lakes, exploring places that can only be reached by daring to leave the shore.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Timeless Cities & Towns
programme.desc: These cities and towns are special places where the past coexists with the present, creating cultures totally unique to their people and their part of the world and adhering to ancient traditions and while introducing modern innovations.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Coasts
programme.desc: Along coasts, one element ends and another begins. No two days are ever the same on a coastline: the only thing that remains a constant is the timeless power of the sea.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Ancient Cities
programme.desc: In Ancient Cities, we journey to these ancestors of influence such as Luang Prabang, Vienna, and Istanbul where religious and cultural centers have shaped the ways in which we view the world around us and continue to do so in modern times.

programme.title: D.W. and the Beastly Birthday
programme.desc: Time to put on your party hats and dancing shoes – D.W. is turning five! When her birthday doesn’t go as planned, D.W. runs away to the magical island of Ukubonga. This is one party you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: Arthur: Muffy's Classy Classics Club/Best Enemies
programme.desc: Muffy buys all of the books and dolls in the Pretty Pioneers series and invites her friends to join a pretty book club. Mom has new clients coming over and they have a daughter who is D.W.'s age. They're going to be the best of friends!

programme.title: Arthur: Just Desserts/The Big Dig
programme.desc: Arthur has a hard time resisting sweets, and one evening his overindulgence wins him an upset stomach and some 'Grimm' dreams. Arthur and D.W. loved it when Grandpa Dave came to visit--but now he only wants to sleep and play checkers.

programme.title: Arthur: Vomitrocious!/Sue Ellen Chickens Out
programme.desc: It's just a regular day until Francine starts to feel queasy, and then throws up in the cafeteria! Now Francine is afraid to go back to school. And, Sue Ellen learns that a fast-food chain is taking over the beloved Sugar Bowl.

programme.title: Arthur: Blabbermouth/All Grown Up
programme.desc: Buster is hurt when he learns his friends don't trust him to keep a secret. Then, the gang finds a mysterious fortune telling game at the library and gets a hint of what their futures could hold.

programme.title: Arthur: Fountain Abbey/Arthur Calls It
programme.desc: Muffy's devastated when she learns her great, great grandmother Mary Alice wasn't royalty, but a common maid. Pressure from his classmates has Arthur doubting his decision to call Buster out during a baseball game.

programme.title: Arthur: Desert Island Dish/The Secret About Secrets
programme.desc: When Mr. Ratburn challenges the class to find the perfect food for surviving on a desert island, everyone picks potato chips or ice cream! D.W. is told a secret and quickly learns that keeping one is a lot harder than she thought.

programme.title: Arthur: Sue Ellen Moves In/The Perfect Brother
programme.desc: A new girl has arrived in town and no one knows anything about her. And judging by the strange things happening at her house no one wants to know. Then, it's great having a friend spend the weekend.

programme.title: Arthur: D.W. Beats All/Buster the Myth Maker
programme.desc: After the Tibbles get a set of drums to play at the music festival, D.W. is determined to get an even bigger and louder one. Then, Buster is always telling the most incredible stories, but now he claims there is a tiger in the state forest.

programme.title: Secret War: The French Triple Agent
programme.desc: Operation Cockade, led by MI6's double agent Henri Dericourt in 1943, aimed to deceive Germans with sabotage. Despite efforts, Germans withdrew divisions unconvinced. Dericourt faced a post-war treason trial and died in a mysterious 1962 plane crash.

programme.title: Secret War: The Spymistress and the French Fiasco
programme.desc: After WWII, SOE disbanded, leaving Vera Atkins to uncover fates of 118 agents, including 13 women. Many were betrayed and sent to camps; some were executed. Atkins' quest continued, marked by personal impact and delayed recognition.

programme.title: Secret War: The SAS Italian Job
programme.desc: In 1945, during the Italian Spring offensive, SOE agent Michael Lees and SAS officer Roy Farran led a raid on German HQs at Villa Rossi and Villa Calvi. Despite orders to cancel, Farran attacked with SAS men and partisans, killing many Germans.

programme.title: Secret War: The Dutch Disaster
programme.desc: Operation North Pole was a WWII German deception using captured SOE agents to mislead Britain. 47 of 50 agents were captured. Despite warnings, SOE ignored signs of compromise to maintain support, leading to a major intelligence failure.

programme.title: Secret War: The Scholar and the Fight for Greece
programme.desc: Monty Woodhouse, a professor and a legend for blowing up the Gorgopotamos Bridge in Greece in 1942. In the British counter attack against Rommell at Al Alamein in North Africa it was vital to disrupt German supply routes, Greece.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Jaylin is prepared to sacrifice a lifelong friendship and promising videogame career to be with a woman he's never even spoken to on the phone. (S5, ep5)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Cassie & Steve
programme.desc: Cassie was on a downward spiral until she got a friend request from a rapper named Steve. Two and a half years later, Cassie and Steve are engaged - but they have yet to meet. (S2, ep1)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Antwane & Tony
programme.desc: Nev and Max are contacted by Carmen who is sounding the alarm on behalf of her cousin, Antwane. He's been in a 3-year romance with a man named Tony that he met on a telephone chat line. (S3, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Ray is determined to meet his online love Lexi. After learning that her sister has meddled in their relationship in the past, Nev and Max find themselves asking more questions. (S5, ep7)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Mike and Caroline
programme.desc: Mike fell in love with Caroline online. He grew suspicious when she continually evaded meeting him, yet left notes at his car. Is Caroline an imposter or is she just afraid? (S2, ep16)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Chanelle is the light Michael needed in his life, but out of the blue she's disappeared, leaving only Nev and Max to help him find his missing love. (S5, ep6)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Reunion Special 2
programme.desc: The cast is back together to dish the dirt on Miami - from bromances and romances, to the infamous note and the fights that followed! (S2, ep14)

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Back to the Shore
programme.desc: Leftover tension from Miami spills over to Seaside when unresolved issues among the girls explode on the first night. And new roommate Deena gets naked in front of The Situation! Series 3, Episode 1.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: It's Gonna Be an Interesting Summer
programme.desc: The first night's fight causes tension in the house. Ronnie & Sammi keep isolating themselves, but things really explode when Ronnie decides to chill with the other housemates. Series 3, Episode 2.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Family Vacation: What's In the Bag?
programme.desc: After five years apart, our favorite guidos are reuniting in Miami for a family vacation, but The Situation's legal issues have put his vacation in jeopardy.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Family Vacation: The Ring
programme.desc: In this spectacular episode, Ronnie and Deena's unresolved issues resurface, and the family is complete with the arrival of The Situation.

programme.title: Jersey Shore: Family Vacation: Sunday Vinday
programme.desc: Ronnie clogs all the toilets in the house, and Nicole and Vinny's past jeopardizes their friendship

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Mystery of Slide Mountain
programme.desc: A report that examines evidence and unanswered questions regarding a June 1, 1998 auto accident on Slide Mountain, near Reno, Nevada, that led to the death of Rinette Riella Bergna and left the driver, Rinette’s husband Peter with only minor injuries.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Temptation in Texas
programme.desc: A report about the 2011 shooting death of Greg Williams, and the question of whether he was killed with his own gun by an intruder inside his suburban Dallas home - as his wife Michele Williams has claimed - or if Michele herself was guilty of the crime.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Buried Secrets of Las Vegas
programme.desc: A report on the death of gaming tycoon Ted Binion, who was found dead in his Las Vegas home. Paranoid about his wealth, he stashed millions of dollars’ worth of silver in a hidden vault in Pahrump, Nevada.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Hunt for Mr. Wright
programme.desc: A report on George Wright, who was sentenced to prison for the 1962 murder of New Jersey service station owner Walter Patterson, and who after spending 8 years in prison, escaped, and spent 40 years on the run from the authorities.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Alternate Suspects
programme.desc: A football coach serves nine years in prison for the murder of his wife before a Texas Court of Criminal Appeals finds he didn't get a fair trial.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Pain and Gain
programme.desc: A report about the crimes of the Sun Gym gang, a group of Miami, Florida drifters, petty thieves, and bodybuilders who kidnapped and killed wealthy people to fuel their lifestyle.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: The Lasagna Zone/Sleepytime Pig/Yojumbo
programme.desc: When Garfield has an accident on the new satellite antennae, he ends up in the TV./Orson Can't get to sleep./Jon decides to learn karate.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Return of the Buddy Bears/Much Ado About Lanolin/Reigning Cats and Dogs
programme.desc: The Buddy Bears help Garfield clean the house./Orson and the gang do an performance of "Taming of the Shrew."/Garfield hosts a TV debate.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Mistakes Will Happen/The Well Dweller/The Wise Man
programme.desc: Garfield addresses viewers comments./Orson drills a well for water./Jon follows the advice of a Wise man.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Pest of a Guest/Impractical Joker/Fat and Furry
programme.desc: Garfield finds competition from a mangy stray./Roy's jokes become so intolerable, that Orson fires the rooster./Garfield buys a winning lottery ticket and becomes a millionaire.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: The Binky Show/U.S. Acres: Keeping Cool/Don't Move!
programme.desc: Garfield decides to win Jon a birthday present on a game show./When Orson's brothers come to torment him./Odie must remain outside a pet store.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: One Good Fern Deserves Another/The Goodie-Go-Round/Health Feud
programme.desc: Jon mistakenly buys a man-eating fern./Orson tries to get a record player for Bo./Jon becomes a health and exercise nut.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: The Garfield Crime Files examines the cast of the Purse-Snatching Pooches.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Lemon Aid/Hog Noon/Video Airlines
programme.desc: Jon wins a free car./A school mate is coming back to settle an old score./Jon decides to go to a video store.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: First Class Feline/Hamelot/How to be funny
programme.desc: Garfield's plan to send Nermal to Abu Dhabi fails./Orson dreams about the knights of the round table./Garfield lectures on what humor is.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: Jon is harassed by a magazine salesman. An escaped saber tooth tiger switches identities with Garfield.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Frame
programme.desc: Gangster Jack Wellman is moving syndicated crime into politics, killing off certain politicians and replacing them with men more sympathetic to the Syndicate.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Diamond
programme.desc: Henrik Durvard has taken over the country of Lombuanada by a military coup, and holds the natives in terror. He has obtained a diamond from the native miners, and the IMF is assigned to take it away from him.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Legend
programme.desc: An imprisoned member of the Nazi party, Herbert Raynor, is released from prison and is being flown to Puerto Huberra in South America, along with other Nazis.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Snowball In Hell
programme.desc: A former prison guard, Sefra, has acquired a supply of cesium 138, which explodes at temperatures above 70 degrees.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Confession
programme.desc: The team must break a Communist assassin who killed a U.S. Senator.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: After BJ loses everyone's tickets to the circus, he learns a valuable lesson about responsibility. Baby Bop discovers a lonely little flower struggling to grow in a shady spot.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Little Red Rock'n Hood - Differences
programme.desc: Baby Bop is having a hard time finding a story she hasn't heard before. Barney and the little dinos decide to tell her an old story with a new twist! They tell the story of "Little Red Riding Hood" in a whole new way...by singing it!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: That Makes Me Mad!
programme.desc: Barney helps his young friends find good ways to express and deal with angry emotions.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: BJ's Really Cool House
programme.desc: Although the park may be a home away from home for Barney and his friends, BJ wants to build his own "totally awesome, completely cool" house. While BJ works on his house, Barney and the children learn all about houses and homes.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: The Emperor's Contest - The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Everyone is excited about a fishing contest that is being held in the park; everyone except Ryan, who doesn't want to follow the contest rules. When Ryan is tempted not to follow the rules, Barney tells a story called "The Emperor's Contest."

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Riff can’t find his drumsticks anywhere. Barney helps Baby Bop explore many different jobs.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Mother Goose - Fun With Reading
programme.desc: While playing in the caboose, BJ is surprised to learn that "The Land of Mother Goose" truly exists. Several Mother Goose characters have come to ask for help! Parts of their rhymes are missing! When Mother Goose arrives, she fixes the problem.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Bunches of Boxes!
programme.desc: A day of imaginative play and fun for Barney and his young friends is kicked off by the arrival of a variety of boxes from the "Enjoy-Your-Toys Company." Surprisingly, every box is empty!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Easy as ABC
programme.desc: When Baby Bop uses the caboose mailbox to deliver a special invitation to her tea party, she discovers that no one can read her handwriting. Barney and his friends find creative ways to help her learn her ABCs!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Space Cowboys
programme.desc: With the pawn shop history, Ton and Allen start the next chapter of their careers with a bang. They uncover an antique WWII firearm and a Russian cosmonaut space suit, which could be their biggest find to date...if it's real.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Risk & Reward
programme.desc: Ton & Allen arrive late to an auction. They uncover vintage bear traps and a bounty of street art. If the pieces belong to the artist, RISK, it could be their biggest score ever. If not, they'll be stuck with forged knockoffs.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Brew-Phoria

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Ramped Up

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE The Unsinkable Ton
programme.desc: Unique finds lead the guys to some cool sales. They try to authenticate props from the film Titanic, Ton faces off with a rattler during a snakebite kit sale, and Allen gets into ice carving while unloading some chainsaws.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Haff-Inated

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Big Sis Ducks Out
programme.desc: Big Sis drops some bad news as the guys clash with Carolyn over a carnival unit at an auction in Long Beach. Ton and Allen unearth a Native American tomahawk, a dunk tank and a rare gun that can fire three shots at once.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Carolyn Goes Topless
programme.desc: A friendly competition with former employee Carolyn turns into a vicious battle for a 1968 Corvette Stingray, giving Carolyn the last laugh. Allen tests his Ninja skills with an antique sickle weapon.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: NEW EPISODE Rock-et to Me!
programme.desc: Ton and Allen end up in a turf war at a Hollywood auction and at odds with each other over whether to gamble on what could be an antique slot machine. Allen attempts to fly a jetpack.

programme.desc: The guys get stuck with a unit they didn't want and have to sort through trash to make their bottom line. They uncover glass blowing tools, autographed baseballs and a hockey puck launcher, which puts Ton in the line of fire.

programme.title: Mutant X

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: Brennan is captured and falls under Eckhart's control, and he is forced to work against the New Mutants.

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: Mutant X comes to the aid of a teenager New Mutant pursued by Russians because she holds the secret to a new weapon that targets mutants.

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: Shalimar becomes close to another feral when it's "lust at first sight," but matters become complicated when her new boyfriend tries to find a cure for his condition.

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: A New Mutant is kidnapped from his family, and Mutant X sets out to recover him and find out what Eckhart's interest in him is.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Float Like a Butterfly
programme.desc: Elijah Good, a doctor from an Amish community, asks Boone for help with some unexpected deaths. They might have to do with a Taelon-related disease.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Resurrection
programme.desc: Doors makes a public appearance, leading to an increase in anti-Taelon sentiment. The Taelon Synod is fed up with Da'an and sends Zo'or in his stead.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Horizon Zero
programme.desc: A high profile mission to Mars is suddenly canceled, much to the dismay of the public. Involved air force captain Paul Chandler steals Lili's shuttle.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Scopions Dream
programme.desc: Dr. Larry Clark is a bio engineer who works on the skrills. When the companions decide to get rid of a series, one of them joins with Clark.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Live Free or Die
programme.desc: Navy Seal major Raymond McIntyre kidnaps Da'an and demands to know where his men are. They were involved in a inter-dimensional space flight test that went wrong.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Scarecrow Returns
programme.desc: Research continues on the 'scarecrow' probe. Boone starts learning Taelon to interpret its messages. The device meanwhile absorbs a scientist, Rayna.

programme.title: The Lost World: Mark of the Beast
programme.desc: Marguerite and Roxton discover a strange amulet that leaves the mark of a dinosaur on their skin. Those with the imprint begin to tap into their more primitive instincts.

programme.title: The Lost World: Survivors
programme.desc: The explorers discover an ancient Temple, where they face off against mystical and experience hallucinations. One of these visions gives them a map that leads Challenger to William Maple White.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Pirate's Curse
programme.desc: A seismic event opens the earth and send Marguerite and Roxton into a pit, where they discover a pirate's buried treasure...and his bones. A curse on the booty complicates matters.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Visitor
programme.desc: After Malone is attacked by a beast, he and Veronica meet her old friend Danu, who has also been injured. Danu goes missing, and the group travels to his village learning he is a werewolf.

programme.title: The Lost World: A Man of Vision
programme.desc: The five adventurers all experience visions of Summerlee, the companion they had presumed dead after he disappeared into a waterfall. They suffer injury and face danger as they pursue the vision.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Father and son team Dan and Peter Snow go head-to-head with Charlie Ross and Charles Hanson on the hunt for the best antique deals as they travel through Hampshire and along the south coast, ending at an auction in Billingshurst, Sussex.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Sir Terry Wogan and Caroline Quentin add a touch of class as they seek profits to donate to Children In Need. In a classic 1948 Jaguar MK 4 they tour Oxfordshire with Charlie Ross and Charles Hanson toward a showdown in Chiswick, London.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: British treasures Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie team up with experts Catherine Southon and James Lewis. They trawl the UK for fabulous antiques, from Potters Bar, through Hampstead and ending at auction in Heathfield, East Sussex.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: TV presenters Fiona Phillips and Richard Madeley go head-to-head with the help of experts Charles Hanson and James Braxton, in search of antique treasures. They travel the entire length of Cornwall, from Lostwithiel to auction in Bude.

programme.desc: Amber has a proposal for Ste. Chloe dreams of a big house while single Sassi is missing Darren. Shannon and Charlie are left speechless at their gender reveal party. (S6, ep1)

programme.title: Teen Mom UK
programme.desc: Surprise for Chloe as Jordan tells her he isn't sure he wants to be with her. Megan organises a party and learns you can't please everyone. Amber feels overwhelmed. Sassi feels the love. (S6, ep2)

programme.title: Teen Mom UK
programme.desc: Amber and Ste's weekend away doesn't go to plan. Chloe lets rip about Jordan's lads holiday. Megan regrets rejecting a thoughtful gesture from Dylan's girlfriend. Shannon stands her ground. (S6, ep3)

programme.title: Teen Mom UK
programme.desc: Ste can't hold his tongue at Brooklyn's party. Chloe grills Jordan about his lads trip. Megan summons Dylan's girlfriend for a chat. Sassi has her braces off but has nothing to smile about. (S6, ep4)

programme.title: Teen Mom UK
programme.desc: Sassi launches 'Sassi's Salon'. Chloe decides she wants to be a midwife but Jordan has doubts. Megan finds out a secret about Dylan. Shannon lets her insecurities get the better of her. (S6, ep5)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Father and Son
programme.desc: A teenager makes a discovery that could prove his mother's death was not suicide.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: The 2017 murder of famed hairstylist Fabio Sementilli who was found stabbed to death by his pool in Los Angeles. At first, police believed he was the victim of the “knock-knock” burglars, a ring targeting Hollywood celebrities.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Imposter
programme.desc: A report about an elusive con man David Pecard, who has taken on more than 20 identities throughout his life of crime. Pecard has infiltrated police departments and top military posts, put criminals behind bars and even posed as a technician.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Mr. Wonderful
programme.desc: Nicknamed "Mr. Wonderful" by one of his victims, Matt Mathews was everything to the women who lost both their hearts and bank accounts to the prolific con artist. Married at least 11 times, Mathews is believed to have scammed hundreds of people.

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Ghosts of Greenwich
programme.desc: A report on the murder of 15-year-old Martha Moxley in Greenwich, Connecticut and the new developments in Kennedy family member Michael Skakel’s efforts to overturn his 2002 murder conviction of Moxley.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Live To Tell: River's Edge
programme.desc: On January 8, 2000, college students Danielle Keener and Dan Zapp were on a date, walking along a river’s edge outside York, Pennsylvania, when they were kidnapped at gunpoint by a man in a pick-up truck.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Harry sinks into a deep depression after Josie's death. Josie's body holds more questions then answers. Norma's troubled sister, Annie, arrives in Twin Peaks. Wheeler and Audrey hit it off. Cooper's stalemate angers Earle.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Harry is attacked by Jones in his sleep. Audrey and Wheeler begin a relationship. Gordon Cole returns with a report that Windom Earle worked with Major Briggs on Project Bluebook. Cole reinstates Cooper in the FBI.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Cooper and company find the mysterious petroglyph. Windom Earle befriends a rock 'n roll youth, and tells him tales of places called the White and Black Lodge. Pete helps Catherine open the first puzzle box.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Bobby and Shelly reaffirm their love. Cooper calls Shelly, Donna and Audrey together to warn them about Earle. Briggs shows Cooper a tape of Windom Earle making a report on his quest for the Black Lodge.

programme.title: Twin Peaks
programme.desc: Windom Earle sets his sites on the Miss Twin Peaks contest. Lucy chooses a father for her baby. Leo is punished when he frees Major Briggs. Cooper unlocks the key to entering the Black Lodge. Annie and Dale make a commitment to each other.
